column4: oh tomcat.. I am sorry I don't know the procedure for that :(
Whose the guy(s) who's in charge of deciding what goes into the ubuntu-desktop meta package?
I see. Not that there is anything I can do about it, but there's a lot of stuff in ubuntu-desktop that average users don't need.
bicycle-repair? Malayalam fonts? bluez-utils?
And it's an unnecessary startup program. The first thing I do is "update-rc.d -f bluez-utils remove"
Does either of Breezy or Dapper LiveCD have the ability to boot into command line mode only?
I believe you can switch into command line with ctl alt f2
if you are using gdm (gnome)
alejandro: that's true, but that defeats the purpose. I am talking about some quick repair that I need to do, and I use the LiveCD and want to quikly log into command line only.
Are there any electrical engineers in here? I am looking for a nice Spice program on linux. :)
livecd goes straight into gnome
I think there is a recovery mode though
alejandro: yeah, I want to avoid that. Is that possible?
They are called factoids. You can ask the IRC bot here (ubotu)
I can't remember the boot options for the livecd off the top of my head
You can send ubotu a private message using the command "/msg ubotu <factoid>" and it will tell you what it knows on the topic.
there might be a command line one
alejandro: Never mind thanks a lot though .. I am guessing there must ..
harisund
use failsafe
Sinta[x]  Preferrably Windows first.
alejandro: Oh thanks.. didn't realize that was command line mode.. :) sounded suspicious ..
you can also do that from an install of ubuntu
from grub when you pick the failsafe version of a kernel, it is console mode
